datadir.name: Data Storage Location
datadir.description: The directory that lnd stores all wallet, chain, and channel related data within. Environment variables are expanded so they may be used. NOTE: Windows environment variables are typically %VARIABLE%, but they must be accessed with $VARIABLE here. Also, ~ is expanded to $LOCALAPPDATA on Windows.

logdir.name: Log directory
logdir.description: The directory that logs are stored in. The logs are auto-rotated by default. Rotated logs are compressed in place.

maxlogfiles.name: Max log files
maxlogfiles.description: Number of logfiles that the log rotation should keep. Setting it to 0 disables deletion of old log files.

maxlogfilesize.name: Max log file size (in MB)
maxlogfilesize.description: Max log file size in MB before it is rotated.

acceptortimeout.name: Acceptor timeout (in seconds)
acceptortimeout.description: Time after which an RPCAcceptor will time out and return false if it hasn't yet received a response.

tlscertpath.name: TLS Cert path
tlscertpath.description: Path to TLS certificate for lnd's RPC and REST services.

tlskeypath.name: TLS Key path
tlskeypath.description: Path to TLS private key for lnd's RPC and REST services.

tlsextraip.name: TLS extra ip
tlsextraip.description: Adds an extra ip to the generated certificate. Setting multiple tlsextraip= entries is allowed. (old tls files must be deleted if changed)

tlsextradomain.name: TLS extra domain
tlsextradomain.description: Adds an extra domain to the generate certificate. Setting multiple tlsextradomain= entries is allowed. (old tls files must be deleted if changed)

tlsautorefresh.name: TLS Auto refresh
tlsautorefresh.description: If set, then all certs will automatically be refreshed if they're close to  expiring, or if any parameters related to extra IPs or domains in the cert change.

tlscertduration.name: TLS cert duration
tlscertduration.description: The duration from generating the self signed certificate to the certificate expiry date. Valid time units are {s, m, h}. The below value is about 14 months (14 * 30 * 24 = 10080)

tlsdisableautofill.name: TLS disable autofill
tlsdisableautofill.description: Do not include the interface IPs or the system hostname in TLS certificate, use first --tlsextradomain as Common Name instead, if set.

externalhosts.name: External hosts
externalhosts.description: A list of domains for lnd to periodically resolve, and advertise the resolved IPs for the backing node. This is useful for users that only have a dynamic IP, or want to expose the node at a domain.

letsencryptdir.name: Lets Encrypt directory
letsencryptdir.description: Sets the directory to store Let's Encrypt certificates within

letsencryptlisten.name: Lets Encrypt listen
letsencryptlisten.description: The IP:port on which lnd will listen for Let's Encrypt challenges. Let's Encrypt will always try to contact on port 80. Often non-root processes are not allowed to bind to ports lower than 1024. This configuration option allows a different port to be used, but must be used in combination with port forwarding from port 80. This configuration can also be used to specify another IP address to listen on, for example an IPv6 address.

letsencryptdomain.name: Lets Encrypt domain
letsencryptdomain.description: Request a Let's Encrypt certificate for this domain. Note that the certificate is only requested and stored when the first rpc connection comes in.

no-macaroons.name: No macaroons
no-macaroons.description: Disable macaroon authentication. Macaroons are used as bearer credentials to authenticate all RPC access. If one wishes to opt out of macaroons, uncomment the line below.

sync-freelist.name: Sync freelist
sync-freelist.description: Enable free list syncing for the default bbolt database. This will decrease start up time, but can result in performance degradation for very large databases, and also result in higher memory usage. If 'free list corruption' is detected, then this flag may resolve things.

adminmacaroonpath.name: Admin macaroon path
adminmacaroonpath.description: Path to write the admin macaroon for lnd's RPC and REST services if it doesn't exist. This can be set if one wishes to store the admin macaroon in a distinct location. By default, it is stored within lnd's network directory. Applications that are able to read this file, gain admin macaroon access.

readonlymacaroonpath.name: Readonly macaroon path
readonlymacaroonpath.description: Path to write the read-only macaroon for lnd's RPC and REST services if it doesn't exist. This can be set if one wishes to store the read-only macaroon in a distinct location. The read only macaroon allows users which can read the file to access RPCs which don't modify the state of the daemon. By default, it is stored within lnd's network directory.

invoicemacaroonpath.name: Invoice macaroon path
invoicemacaroonpath.description: Path to write the invoice macaroon for lnd's RPC and REST services if it doesn't exist. This can be set if one wishes to store the invoice macaroon in a distinct location. By default, it is stored within lnd's network directory. The invoice macaroon allows users which can read the file to gain read and write access to all invoice related RPCs.

payments-expiration-grace-period.name: Payments expiration grace period
payments-expiration-grace-period.description: A period to wait before for closing channels with outgoing htlcs that have  timed out and are a result of this nodes instead payment. In addition to our  current block based deadline, if specified this grace period will also be taken into account. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

listen.name: Listen
listen.description: Specify the interfaces to listen on for p2p connections. One listen address per line. All ipv4 on port 9735: listen=0.0.0.0:9735. On all ipv4 interfaces on port 9735 and ipv6 localhost port 9736: listen=0.0.0.0:9735, listen=[::1]:9736

nolisten.name: No listen
nolisten.description: Disable listening for incoming p2p connections. This will override all listeners.

rpclisten.name: RPC listen
rpclisten.description: Specify the interfaces to listen on for gRPC connections. One listen address per line. Only ipv4 localhost on port 10009: rpclisten=localhost:10009. On ipv4 localhost port 10009 and ipv6 port 10010: rpclisten=localhost:10009 rpclisten=[::1]:10010. On an Unix socket: rpclisten=unix:///var/run/lnd/lnd-rpclistener.sock

restlisten.name: REST listen
restlisten.description: Specify the interfaces to listen on for REST connections. One listen address per line. All ipv4 interfaces on port 8080: restlisten=0.0.0.0:8080. On ipv4 localhost port 80 and 443: restlisten=localhost:80, restlisten=localhost:443. On an Unix socket: restlisten=unix:///var/run/lnd-restlistener.sock

restcors.name: REST CORS
restcors.description: A series of domains to allow cross origin access from. This controls the CORs policy of the REST RPC proxy.

externalip.name: External IP
externalip.description: Adding an external IP will advertise your node to the network. This signals that your node is available to accept incoming channels. If you don't wish to advertise your node, this value doesn't need to be set. Unless specified (with host:port notation), the default port (9735) will be added to the address.

nat.name: NAT
nat.description: Instead of explicitly stating your external IP address, you can also enable UPnP or NAT-PMP support on the daemon. Both techniques will be tried and require proper hardware support. In order to detect this hardware support, `lnd` uses a dependency that retrieves the router's gateway address by using different built-in binaries in each platform. Therefore, it is possible that we are unable to detect the hardware and `lnd` will exit with an error indicating this. This option will automatically retrieve your external IP address, even after it has changed in the case of dynamic IPs, and advertise it to the network using the ports the daemon is listening on. This does not support devices behind multiple NATs.

no-rest-tls.name: no-rest-tls
no-rest-tls.description: Disable TLS for the REST API.

addpeer.name: Add peers
addpeer.description: Specify peer(s) to connect to first.

ws-ping-interval.name: WS ping interval
ws-ping-interval.description: The ping interval for REST based WebSocket connections, set to 0 to disable sending ping messages from the server side. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

ws-pong-wait.name: WS pong wait
ws-pong-wait.description: The time we wait for a pong response message on REST based WebSocket connections before the connection is closed as inactive. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

minbackoff.name: Min back off
minbackoff.description: Shortest backoff when reconnecting to persistent peers. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

maxbackoff.name: Max back off
maxbackoff.description: Longest backoff when reconnecting to persistent peers. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

connectiontimeout.name: Connection timeout
connectiontimeout.description: The timeout value for network connections in seconds, default to 120 seconds. Valid uints are {ms, s, m, h}.

debuglevel.name: Debug level
debuglevel.description: Debug logging level. Valid levels are {trace, debug, info, warn, error, critical} You may also specify <global-level>,<subsystem>=<level>,<subsystem2>=<level>,...  to set log level for individual subsystems. Use lncli debuglevel --show to  list available subsystems.

cpuprofile.name: CPU profile
cpuprofile.description: Write CPU profile to the specified file.

profile.name: Profile
profile.description: Enable HTTP profiling on given port -- NOTE port must be between 1024 and 65536. The profile can be access at: http://localhost:<PORT>/debug/pprof/.

unsafe-disconnect.name: Unsafe disconnect
unsafe-disconnect.description: DEPRECATED: Allows the rpcserver to intentionally disconnect from peers with open channels. THIS FLAG WILL BE REMOVED IN 0.10.0.

unsafe-replay.name: Unsafe replay
unsafe-replay.description: Causes a link to replay the adds on its commitment txn after starting up, this enables testing of the sphinx replay logic.

maxpendingchannels.name: Max pending channels
maxpendingchannels.description: The maximum number of incoming pending channels permitted per peer.

backupfilepath.name: Backup file path
backupfilepath.description: The target location of the channel backup file.

blockcachesize.name: Block cache size (in MB)
blockcachesize.description: The maximum capacity of the block cache in bytes. Increasing this will result in more blocks being kept in memory but will increase performance when the same block is required multiple times. The example value below is 40 MB (1024 * 1024 * 40)

feeurl.name: Fee URL
feeurl.description: Optional URL for external fee estimation. If no URL is specified, the method for fee estimation will depend on the chosen backend and network. Must be set for neutrino on mainnet.

nobootstrap.name: No bootstrap
nobootstrap.description: If true, then automatic network bootstrapping will not be attempted. This means that your node won't attempt to automatically seek out peers on the network.

noseedbackup.name: No seedbackup
noseedbackup.description: If true, NO SEED WILL BE EXPOSED -- EVER, AND THE WALLET WILL BE ENCRYPTED USING THE DEFAULT PASSPHRASE. THIS FLAG IS ONLY FOR TESTING AND SHOULD NEVER BE USED ON MAINNET.

wallet-unlock-password-file.name: Wallet unlock password file
wallet-unlock-password-file.description: The full path to a file (or pipe/device) that contains the password for unlocking the wallet; if set, no unlocking through RPC is possible and lnd will exit if no wallet exists or the password is incorrect; if wallet-unlock-allow-create is also set then lnd will ignore this flag if no wallet exists and allow a wallet to be created through RPC.

wallet-unlock-allow-create.name: Wallet unlock allow create
wallet-unlock-allow-create.description: Don't fail with an error if wallet-unlock-password-file is set but no wallet exists yet. Not recommended for auto-provisioned or high-security systems because the wallet creation RPC is unauthenticated and an attacker could inject a seed while lnd is in that state.

reset-wallet-transactions.name: Reset wallet transactions
reset-wallet-transactions.description: Removes all transaction history from the on-chain wallet on startup, forcing a full chain rescan starting at the wallet's birthday. Implements the same functionality as btcwallet's dropwtxmgr command. Should be set to false after successful execution to avoid rescanning on every restart of lnd.

minchansize.name: Min chan size
minchansize.description: The smallest channel size (in satoshis) that we should accept. Incoming channels smaller than this will be rejected, default value 20000.

maxchansize.name: Max chan size
maxchansize.description: The largest channel size (in satoshis) that we should accept. Incoming channels larger than this will be rejected. For non-Wumbo channels this  limit remains 16777215 satoshis by default as specified in BOLT-0002. For wumbo channels this limit is 1,000,000,000 satoshis (10 BTC). Set this config option explicitly to restrict your maximum channel size to better align with your risk tolerance

coop-close-target-confs.name: Coop close target confs
coop-close-target-confs.description: The target number of blocks in which a cooperative close initiated by a remote peer should be confirmed. This target is used to estimate the starting fee rate that will be used during fee negotiation with the peer. This target is is also used for cooperative closes initiated locally if the --conf_target for the channel closure is not set.

channel-commit-interval.name: Channel commit interval
channel-commit-interval.description: The maximum time that is allowed to pass between receiving a channel state update and signing the next commitment. Setting this to a longer duration allows for more efficient channel operations at the cost of latency. This is capped at 1 hour. The default is 50 milliseconds.

pending-commit-interval.name: Pending commit interval
pending-commit-interval.description: The maximum time that is allowed to pass while waiting for the remote party to revoke a locally initiated commitment state. Setting this to a longer duration if a slow response is expected from the remote party or large number of payments are attempted at the same time. (default: 1m0s)

channel-commit-batch-size.name: Channel commit batch size
channel-commit-batch-size.description: The maximum number of channel state updates that is accumulated before signing a new commitment.

keep-failed-payment-attempts.name: Keep failed payment attempts
keep-failed-payment-attempts.description: Keeps persistent record of all failed payment attempts for successfully settled payments.

default-remote-max-htlcs.name: Default remote max htlcs
default-remote-max-htlcs.description: The default max_htlc applied when opening or accepting channels. This value limits the number of concurrent HTLCs that the remote party can add to the commitment. The maximum possible value is 483.

chan-enable-timeout.name: Chan enable timeout
chan-enable-timeout.description: The duration that a peer connection must be stable before attempting to send a channel update to re-enable or cancel a pending disables of the peer's channels on the network. (default: 19m0s)

chan-disable-timeout.name: Chan disable timeout
chan-disable-timeout.description: The duration that must elapse after first detecting that an already active  channel is actually inactive and sending channel update disabling it to the  network. The pending disable can be canceled if the peer reconnects and becomes stable for chan-enable-timeout before the disable update is sent. (default: 20m0s)

chan-status-sample-interval.name: Chan status sample interval
chan-status-sample-interval.description: The polling interval between attempts to detect if an active channel has become inactive due to its peer going offline. (default: 1m0s)

height-hint-cache-query-disable.name: Height hint cache query disable
height-hint-cache-query-disable.description: Disable queries from the height-hint cache to try to recover channels stuck in the pending close state. Disabling height hint queries may cause longer chain rescans, resulting in a performance hit. Unset this after channels are unstuck so you can get better performance again.

historicalsyncinterval.name: Historical sync interval
historicalsyncinterval.description: The polling interval between historical graph sync attempts. Each historical graph sync attempt ensures we reconcile with the remote peer's graph from the genesis block. (default: 1h0m0s)

ignore-historical-gossip-filters.name: Ignore historical gossip filters
ignore-historical-gossip-filters.description: If true, will not reply with historical data that matches the range specified by a remote peer's gossip_timestamp_filter. Doing so will result in lower memory and bandwidth requirements.

rejectpush.name: Reject push
rejectpush.description: If true, lnd will not accept channel opening requests with non-zero push amounts. This should prevent accidental pushes to merchant nodes.

rejecthtlc.name: Reject HTLC
rejecthtlc.description: If true, lnd will not forward any HTLCs that are meant as onward payments. This option will still allow lnd to send HTLCs and receive HTLCs but lnd won't be used as a hop.

requireinterceptor.name: Require Interceptor
requireinterceptor.description: If true, all HTLCs will be held until they are handled by an interceptor

stagger-initial-reconnect.name: Stagger initial reconnect
stagger-initial-reconnect.description: If true, will apply a randomized staggering between 0s and 30s when reconnecting to persistent peers on startup. The first 10 reconnections will be attempted instantly, regardless of the flag's value

max-cltv-expiry.name: Max cltv expiry
max-cltv-expiry.description: The maximum number of blocks funds could be locked up for when forwarding payments. (default: 2016)

max-channel-fee-allocation.name: Max channel fee allocation
max-channel-fee-allocation.description: The maximum percentage of total funds that can be allocated to a channel's commitment fee. This only applies for the initiator of the channel. Valid values are within [0.1, 1]. (default: 0.5)

max-commit-fee-rate-anchors.name: Max commit fee rate anchors
max-commit-fee-rate-anchors.description: The maximum fee rate in sat/vbyte that will be used for commitments of channels of the anchors type. Must be large enough to ensure transaction propagation (default: 10)

dust-threshold.name: Dust threshold
dust-threshold.description: A threshold defining the maximum amount of dust a given channel can have after which forwarding and sending dust HTLC's to and from the channel will fail. This amount is expressed in satoshis. (default: 500000)

dry-run-migration.name: Dry run migration
dry-run-migration.description: If true, lnd will abort committing a migration if it would otherwise have been successful. This leaves the database unmodified, and still compatible with the previously active version of lnd.

enable-upfront-shutdown.name: Enable upfront shutdown
enable-upfront-shutdown.description: If true, option upfront shutdown script will be enabled. If peers that we open channels with support this feature, we will automatically set the script to which cooperative closes should be paid out to on channel open. This offers the partial protection of a channel peer disconnecting from us if cooperative close is attempted with a different script.

accept-keysend.name: Accept keysend
accept-keysend.description: If true, spontaneous payments through keysend will be accepted. This is a temporary solution until AMP is implemented which is expected to be soon. This option will then become deprecated in favor of AMP.

keysend-hold-time.name: Keysend hold time
keysend-hold-time.description: If non-zero, keysend payments are accepted but not immediately settled. If the payment isn't settled manually after the specified time, it is canceled automatically. [experimental]

accept-amp.name: Accept AMP
accept-amp.description: If true, spontaneous payments through AMP will be accepted. Payments to AMP invoices will be accepted regardless of this setting.

gc-canceled-invoices-on-startup.name: GC canceled invoices on startup
gc-canceled-invoices-on-startup.description: If true, we'll attempt to garbage collect canceled invoices upon start.

gc-canceled-invoices-on-the-fly.name: GC canceled invoices on the fly
gc-canceled-invoices-on-the-fly.description: If true, we'll delete newly canceled invoices on the fly.

allow-circular-route.name: Allow circular route
allow-circular-route.description: If true, our node will allow htlc forwards that arrive and depart on the same channel.

trickledelay.name: Trickle delay
trickledelay.description: Time in milliseconds between each release of announcements to the network

numgraphsyncpeers.name: Num graph sync peers
numgraphsyncpeers.description: The number of peers that we should receive new graph updates from. This option can be tuned to save bandwidth for light clients or routing nodes. (default: 3)

prometheus.enable.name: prometheus enable
prometheus.enable.description: If true, lnd will start the Prometheus exporter. Prometheus flags are  behind a build/compile flag and are not available by default. lnd must be built  with the monitoring tag; `make && make install tags=monitoring` to activate them.

prometheus.listen.name: Prometheus listen
prometheus.listen.description: Specify the interface to listen on for Prometheus connections.

prometheus.perfhistograms.name: Prometheus perfhistograms
prometheus.perfhistograms.description: If true, then we'll export additional information that allows users to plot the processing latency, and total time spent across each RPC calls+service. This generates additional memory load for the Prometheus server, and will end up using more disk space over time.

alias.name: Alias
alias.description: The alias your node will use, which can be up to 32 UTF-8 characters in length.

color.name: Color
color.description: The color of the node in hex format, used to customize node appearance in intelligence services.

debug.description: Features that help developers who are testing changes to Bitcoin Core.

uacomment.name: User Agent Comment
uacomment.description: Append comment to the user agent string.

addrmantest.name: Address Manager Test
addrmantest.description: Allows you to test address relay on localhost.

capturemessages.name: Capture Messages
capturemessages.description: Capture all P2P messages to disk.

checkblocks.name: Check Blocks
checkblocks.description: How many recent blocks to check at startup.

checklevel.name: Check Block Level
checklevel.description: How thorough the block verification of -checkblocks is (0-4).

checkaddrman.name: Check Address Manager
checkaddrman.description: Run addrman consistency checks every <n> operations.

checkmempool.name: Check Mempool
checkmempool.description: Run mempool consistency checks every <n> transactions.

checkpoints.name: Enable Checkpoints
checkpoints.description: Disable expensive verification for known chain history.

dbcrashratio.name: DB Crash Ratio
dbcrashratio.description: Randomly crash while writing data at a given rate between 0 and 1.

fastprune.name: Fast Prune
fastprune.description: Use smaller block files and lower minimum prune height for testing purposes.

stopafterblockimport.name: Stop After Block Import
stopafterblockimport.description: Stop running after importing blocks from disk.

stopatheight.name: Stop At Height
stopatheight.description: Stop running after reaching the given height in the main chain.

testactivationheight.name: Test Activation Height
testactivationheight.description: Set the activation height of of 'name' (segwit, bip34, dersig, cltv, csv) via 'name@height' (regtest-only).

limitancestorcount.name: Limit Transaction Ancestor Count
limitancestorcount.description: Do not accept transactions if number of in-mempool ancestors is <n> or more.

limitancestorsize.name: Limit Transaction Ancestor Size
limitancestorsize.description: Do not accept transactions whose size with all in-mempool ancestors exceeds <n> kilobytes.

limitdescendantcount.name: Limit Transaction Descendant Count
limitdescendantcount.description: Do not accept transactions if any ancestor would have <n> or more in-mempool descendants.

limitdescendantsize.name: Limit Transaction Descendant Size
limitdescendantsize.description: Do not accept transactions whose size with all in-mempool descendants exceeds <n> kilobytes.

description.1: Enable debug logging for all categories.

logips.name: Log IP Addresses
logips.description: Log IP Addresses in debug output.

logsourcelocations.name: Log Source Locations
logsourcelocations.description: Prepend debug output with name of the originating source location (source file, line number and function name).

logthreadnames.name: Log Thread Names
logthreadnames.description: Prepend debug output with name of the originating thread (only available on platforms supporting thread_local).

mocktime.name: Mock Timestamps
mocktime.description: Replace actual time with <n> seconds since epoch.

maxsigcachesize.name: Max Signature Cache Size
maxsigcachesize.description: Limit size of signature cache to <n> MiB.

maxtipage.name: Max Age of Chain Tip
maxtipage.description: Maximum tip age in seconds to consider node in initial block download.

maxtxfee.name: Max Transaction Fee
maxtxfee.description: Maximum total fees (in BTC) to use in a single wallet transaction or raw transaction; setting this too low may abort large transactions.

printtoconsole.name: Output to Console
printtoconsole.description: Send trace/debug info to console instead of debug.log.

printpriority.name: Print Priority
printpriority.description: Log transaction fee per kB when mining blocks.

promiscuousmempoolflags.name: Script Verification Flags
promiscuousmempoolflags.description: Integer representing the script verification flags to enable (all ORed together) - flags can be found in interpreter.h.

shrinkdebugfile.name: Shrink Debug Log File
shrinkdebugfile.description: Shrink debug.log file on client startup.

relay.description: Fine tune settings for what transactions your node will relay to peers.

acceptnonstdtxn.name: Accept Non-Standard Transactions
acceptnonstdtxn.description: Relay and mine non-standard transactions (testnet/regtest only.)

incrementalrelayfee.name: Incremental Relay Fee
incrementalrelayfee.description: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) used to define cost of relay, used for mempool limiting and BIP 125 replacement.

dustrelayfee.name: Dust Relay Fee
dustrelayfee.description: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) used to defined dust, the value of an output such that it will cost about 1/3 of its value in fees at this fee rate to spend it.

bytespersigop.name: Bytes Per Signature Operation
bytespersigop.description: Equivalent bytes per sigop in transactions for relay and mining.

datacarriersize.name: Max OP_RETURN Size
datacarriersize.description: Maximum size of data in OP_RETURN outputs we relay and mine.

minrelaytxfee.name: Min Transaction Relay Fee
minrelaytxfee.description: Fee rates (in BTC/kB) smaller than this are considered zero fee for relaying, mining and transaction creation.

whitelistrelay.name: Whitelist Relay
whitelistrelay.description: Accept relayed transactions received from whitelisted peers even when not relaying transactions.

network.description: Options for how your node interacts with other peers on the network.

addnode.name: Connect to Peer
addnode.description: Add a node IP address to connect to and attempt to keep the connection open. This option can be set multiple times.

asmap.name: ASN Mapping
asmap.description: Specify asn mapping used for bucketing of the peers. Relative paths will be prefixed by the net-specific datadir location.

bantime.name: Peer Ban Time
bantime.description: Number of seconds to keep misbehaving peers from reconnecting.

bind.name: Bind to IP Address
bind.description: Bind to given address and always listen on it. (default: 0.0.0.0). Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. Append =onion to tag any incoming connections to that address and port as incoming Tor connections

cjdnsreachable.name: CJDNS Reachable
cjdnsreachable.description: If set, then this host is configured for CJDNS (connecting to fc00::/8 addresses would lead us to the CJDNS network)

connect.name: Only Connect to Peer
connect.description: Connect only to the specified node(s); can be set multiple times. Set to 0 to disable automatic connections.

discover.name: Discover IP Address
discover.description: Discover own IP addresses. If disabled, should be used with -externalip or -proxy.

dns.name: Allow DNS Lookups
dns.description: Allow DNS lookups for -addnode, -seednode and -connect values.

dnsseed.name: Use DNS Seed
dnsseed.description: Query for peer addresses via DNS lookup, if low on addresses.

externalip.name: External IP Address
externalip.description: Specify your own public IP address.

fixedseeds.name: Use Fixed Seeds
fixedseeds.description: Allow fixed seeds if DNS seeds don't provide peers.

forcednsseed.name: Force DNS Seed
forcednsseed.description: Always query for peer addresses via DNS lookup.

i2pacceptincoming.name: Accept Incoming I2P Connections
i2pacceptincoming.description: If set and -i2psam is also set then incoming I2P connections are accepted via the SAM proxy. If this is not set but -i2psam is set then only outgoing connections will be made to the I2P network. Ignored if -i2psam is not set. Listening for incoming I2P connections is done through the SAM proxy, not by binding to a local address and port.

i2psam.name: I2P SAM Proxy
i2psam.description: I2P SAM proxy <ip:port> to reach I2P peers and accept I2P connections.

maxconnections.name: Max Peer Connections
maxconnections.description: Maintain at most N connections to peers.

maxtimeadjustment.name: Max Time Adjustment
maxtimeadjustment.description: Maximum allowed median peer time offset adjustment in seconds. Local perspective of time may be influenced by peers forward or backward by this amount.

natpmp.name: NAT Port Mapping Protocol
natpmp.description: Use NAT-PMP to map the listening port.

onion.name: Tor Proxy
onion.description: Use separate SOCKS5 proxy <ip:port> to reach peers via Tor hidden services.

description.ipv4: Only connect to peers via IPV4
description.ipv6: Only connect to peers via IPV6.
description.onion: Only connect to peers via Tor.

peerblockfilters.name: Permit Peer Block Filters
peerblockfilters.description: Serve compact block filters to peers per BIP 157. NOTE: enabling this will force blockfilterindex on

peerbloomfilters.name: Permit Peer Bloom Filters
peerbloomfilters.description: Support filtering of blocks and transactions with bloom filters.

peertimeout.name: Peer Timeout
peertimeout.description: Specify p2p connection timeout in seconds. The amount of time a peer may be inactive before the connection to it is dropped.

port.name: Listen Port
port.description: Listen for incoming connections on non-default port.

proxyrandomize.name: Randomize Proxy
proxyrandomize.description: Randomize credentials for every proxy connection. This enables Tor stream isolation.

seednode.name: Seed Node
seednode.description: Connect to a node (IP address) to retrieve peer addresses, then disconnect.

timeout.name: Connection Timeout
timeout.description: Initial peer connection timeout in milliseconds.

torcontrol.name: Tor Control
torcontrol.description: Tor control <ip:port> to use if onion listening enabled.

upnp.name: Universal Plug 'n Play
upnp.description: Use UPnP to map the listening port.

whitebind.name: Whitelist Bound IP Address
whitebind.description: Bind to given address and whitelist peers connecting to it. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. Use [permissions]address for permissions. Allowed permissions are bloomfilter, noban, forcerelay, relay, and mempool. Specify multiple permissions separated by commas (default: noban,mempool,relay). Can be specified multiple times.

whitelist.name: Whitelist Peer
whitelist.description: Whitelist peers connecting from the given IP address (e.g. 1.2.3.4) or CIDR notated network (e.g. 1.2.3.0/24). Use [permissions]address for permissions. Uses same permissions as Whitelist Bound IP Address. Can be specified multiple times. Whitelisted peers cannot be DoS banned and their transactions are always relayed, even if they are already in the mempool. Useful for a gateway node.

maxuploadtarget.name: Max Upload Target
maxuploadtarget.description: Tries to keep outbound traffic under the given target (in MiB per 24h), 0 = no limit.

mining.description: Configure attributes of blocks that can be mined by this node.

blockmintxfee.name: Block Min Transaction Fee
blockmintxfee.description: Set lowest fee rate (in BTC/kB) for transactions to be included in block creation.

blockversion.name: Block Version
blockversion.description: Override block version to test forking scenarios.

rpc.description: Configure security and performance options for accessing the node's RPC interface.

server.name: Enable RPC Server
server.description: Accept command line and JSON-RPC commands.

rpcbind.name: Bind RPC Address
rpcbind.description: Bind to given address to listen for JSON-RPC connections. This option is ignored unless -rpcallowip is also passed. Port is optional and overrides -rpcport. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6. This option can be specified multiple times. (default: 127.0.0.1 and ::1 i.e., localhost)

rpccookiefile.name: RPC Cookie Directory
rpccookiefile.description: Location of the RPC auth cookie

rpcauth.name: RPC Auth
rpcauth.description: Username and hashed password for JSON-RPC connections. The field <userpw> comes in the format: <USERNAME>:<SALT>$<HASH>. RPC clients connect using rpcuser=<USERNAME>/rpcpassword=<PASSWORD> arguments. You can generate this value at https://jlopp.github.io/bitcoin-core-rpc-auth-generator/. This option can be specified multiple times.

rpcport.name: RPC Port
rpcport.description: Listen for JSON-RPC connections on this port

rpcallowip.name: RPC Allow IP Address
rpcallowip.description: Allow JSON-RPC connections from specified source. Valid for <ip> are a single IP (e.g. 1.2.3.4), a network/netmask (e.g. 1.2.3.4/255.255.255.0) or a network/CIDR (e.g. 1.2.3.4/24). This option can be specified multiple times.

rpcwhitelistdefault.name: RPC Whitelist Default
rpcwhitelistdefault.description: Sets default behavior for rpc whitelisting. Unless rpcwhitelistdefault is set to 0, if any -rpcwhitelist is set, the rpc server acts as if all rpc users are subject to empty-unless-otherwise-specified whitelists. If rpcwhitelistdefault is set to 1 and no -rpcwhitelist is set, rpc server acts as if all rpc users are subject to empty whitelists.

rpcwhitelist.name: RPC Whitelist
rpcwhitelist.description: Set a whitelist to filter incoming RPC calls for a specific user. The field <whitelist> comes in the format: <USERNAME>:<rpc 1>,<rpc 2>,...,<rpc n>. If multiple whitelists are set for a given user, they are set-intersected.

rpcthreads.name: RPC Threads
rpcthreads.description: Set the number of threads to service RPC calls

rpcworkqueue.name: RPC Work Queue Size
rpcworkqueue.description: Set the depth of the work queue to service RPC calls

description.0: Return raw transaction or block hex with non-SegWit serialization.
description.1: Return raw transaction or block hex with SegWit serialization.

rpcservertimeout.name: RPC Timeout
rpcservertimeout.description: Number of seconds after which an uncompleted RPC call will time out

wallet.description: Configure behavior of the node's wallet.

avoidpartialspends.name: Avoid Partial Spends
avoidpartialspends.description: Group outputs by address, selecting all or none, instead of selecting on a per-output basis. Improves privacy at expense of higher transaction fees.

consolidatefeerate.name: Consolidate Fee Rate
consolidatefeerate.description: The maximum feerate (in BTC/kvB) at which transaction building may use more inputs than strictly necessary so that the wallet's UTXO pool can be reduced

disablewallet.name: Disable Wallet
disablewallet.description: Do not load the wallet and disable wallet RPC calls.

keypool.name: Key Pool Size
keypool.description: Set key pool size to <n>. Recommended to use a large number for high volume non-HD wallets.

fallbackfee.name: Fallback Transaction Fee
fallbackfee.description: A fee rate (in BTC/kB) that will be used when fee estimation has insufficient data

discardfee.name: Discard Change Fee
discardfee.description: The fee rate (in BTC/kB) that indicates your tolerance for discarding change by adding it to the fee

maxapsfee.name: Max Avoid Partial Spend Fee
maxapsfee.description: Spend up to this amount in additional (absolute) fees (in BTC) if it allows the use of partial spend avoidance (default: 0.00)

mintxfee.name: Min Transaction Fee
mintxfee.description: Fee rates (in BTC/kB) smaller than this are considered zero fee for transaction creation

paytxfee.name: Pay Transaction Fee
paytxfee.description: Fee rate (in BTC/kB) to add to transactions you send. Not recommended to set!

spendzeroconfchange.name: Spend Unconfirmed Change
spendzeroconfchange.description: Spend unconfirmed change when sending transactions.

rootcertificates.name: Root Certificate file
rootcertificates.description: Specify a custom root certificate to trust for payment requests. Delete value to disable trusting root certificates.

txconfirmtarget.name: Transaction Fee Confirmation Target
txconfirmtarget.description: If paytxfee is not set, include enough fee so that transactions should confirm within <n> blocks

unsafesqlitesync.name: Unsafe SQL Lite Sync
unsafesqlitesync.description: Disable waiting for the database to sync to disk. This is unsafe and can cause data loss and corruption. This option is only used by tests to improve their performance.

walletrbf.name: Enable Replace By Fee Transactions
walletrbf.description: Send transactions with full-RBF opt-in enabled.

wallet.name: Wallet Path
wallet.description: Specify wallet database path. Can be specified multiple times to load multiple wallets. Path is interpreted relative to <walletdir> if it is not absolute and will be created if it does not exist.

walletdir.name: Wallet Data Storage Location
walletdir.description: Specify a non-default location to store wallet data.

walletbroadcast.name: Broadcast Transactions
walletbroadcast.description: Broadcast transactions created by the wallet.

walletnotify.name: Wallet Notification
walletnotify.description: Execute command when a wallet transaction changes (%s in cmd is replaced by TxID)

dblogsize.name: DB Log Size
dblogsize.description: Flush wallet database activity from memory to disk log every <n> megabytes

flushwallet.name: Flush Wallet Automatically
flushwallet.description: Run a thread to flush wallet periodically.

privdb.name: Private DB
privdb.description: Set the DB_PRIVATE flag in the wallet db environment.

walletrejectlongchains.name: Reject Long Transaction Chains
walletrejectlongchains.description: Wallet will not create transactions that violate mempool chain limits.

batchwindowduration.name: Batch window duration (in seconds)
batchwindowduration.description: Duration of the sweep batch window. The sweep is held back during the batch window to allow more inputs to be added and thereby lower the fee per input.
